dt: {bc}a state of being under obligation to pay or repay someone or something in return for something received {bc}a state of owing
{bc}the {d_link|common-law|common-law} action for the recovery of money held to be due

et: Middle English {it}dette, debte{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}dette{/it} something owed, from Vulgar Latin {it}*debita{/it}, from Latin, plural of {it}debitum{/it} debt, from neuter of {it}debitus{/it}, past participle of {it}debēre{/it} to owe, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}habēre{/it} to have {ma}{mat|give|}{/ma}
shortdef: a state of being under obligation to pay or repay someone or something in return for something received : a state of owing
the common-law action for the recovery of money held to be due

dt: {bc}the amount of interest and sinking fund payments due annually on long-term debt

shortdef: the amount of interest and sinking fund payments due annually on long-term debt

dt: {bc}the amount of money that one owes

shortdef: the amount of money that one owes

dt: {bc}the amount of money that someone owes

shortdef: the amount of money that someone owes

stems: owe them a debt of gratitude

dt: {bc}appreciation or thanks that someone should give another person

dt.t: We {phrase}owe them a debt of gratitude{/phrase} for all the help they've given us.

shortdef: appreciation or thanks that someone should give another person

dt: used in phrases such as {phrase}pay your debt to society{/phrase} to refer to being punished for committing a crime

dt.t: After 10 years in prison, he has {it}paid his debt to society{/it} and is a free man.

shortdef: —used in phrases such as pay your debt to society to refer to being punished for committing a crime

dt: {bc}a cumulative deficit of oxygen available for oxidative metabolism that develops during periods of intense bodily activity and must be made good when the body returns to rest

shortdef: a cumulative deficit of oxygen available for oxidative metabolism that develops during periods of intense bodily activity and must be made good when the body returns to rest

dt.t: banks with millions of dollars of {it}bad debt{/it}

shortdef: loans that will not be repaid

dt: {bc}a debt from buying something at a store

dt.t: Most of his debts are {it}consumer debts{/it}.

shortdef: a debt from buying something at a store
